title: Sort of like Avant Garde, yet definitely not...
content:
Hello! Anybody know this one? It's got obvious similarities to Avant Garde, but the R is connected to the vertical stem, and the u and M are clearly different.

Font: 

 Futura 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Rejuv font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/typophile.com/files/Rejuv%20font.jpg) | 27.08 KB |
author: daveward

comments.content: Almost identical to Futura, save for the j....

Confirming Kevin's guess of Futura with a custom /j. Baseline is also definitely set in Futura and to be precise should be either Futura from [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura), [Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/futura) or [URW++](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/futura) (no [Bitstream](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura)/ [Tilde](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/futura)). Type has also been slightly vertically compressed.  
The rest of their identity uses [Brandon Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/brandon-grotesque) (same kinf of /j as logotype but rounded, borrowed from it?), Times and Open Sans.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155950im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_5084.png)
The rest of the identity is Beau. She wants to change it to the Logo face. And I can't believe I didn't figure Futura myself. What a rookie mistake. Wow, I must really be losing it. Thank you!!! :)

daveward, I've seen Neutraface on this site so many times that I should recognize it on sight, but I still think it's something new every time. We all have our blind spots. Good luck with your rebrand.
